title: Is the abuser always a stranger?
content: No. In fact, in at least 31% of the cases the abuser is a relative - a parent, an aunty or uncle, a cousin, or other relative. In most cases, the abuser is known to the child either through family or family friends or neighbours, school teachers or other known persons. This is a factor that helps hide the abuse because the child will assume that this person would not do anything to hurt him / her.
